sen.j: 歩（ぶ）は、尺貫法における長さの単位である。
sen.e: Bu is a unit of length under the shakkanho.
Bu is a unit of length under the shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures).
sen.cmt: shakkanhoの補足追加 (用語集参照
sen.e: Bu is a unit of length under the shakkanho (old Japanese system of weights and measures).

sen.j: 古代中国の周代に制定されたものである。
sen.e: The unit originated in the Zhou Dynasty in China.
The unit originated in the Zhou Dynasty in China.
The unit originated in the Zhou Dynasty in China.

sen.j: 右足を踏み出し、次に左足を踏み出した時の、起点から踏み出した左足までの長さ（日本語でいう「2歩」）を「1歩」とする身体尺であった。
sen.e: Bu was body measurement and "one bu" was the length of two steps.
Bu was body measurement and "one bu" was the length of two steps.
Bu was body measurement and "one bu" was the length of two steps.

sen.j: 後に尺と関連づけられて、8尺または6尺の長さとされるようになった。
sen.e: It was later related to shaku and considered as the length of eight or six shaku.
It was later related to shaku and considered to be the length of eight or six shaku.
sen.cmt: considered as→considered to beとしました。
sen.e: It was later related to shaku and considered to be equal to the length of six or eight shaku.

sen.j: 8尺、6尺はそれぞれ約2.4m、約1.8mで歩幅にしては少し長いが、これは尺が現在よりも短かった時代に尺と関連づけられたためである。
sen.e: Eight shaku (about 2.4m) or six shaku (about 1.8m) is longer than two steps but the basic unit of shaku was shorter in the times when bu was related to shaku
Eight shaku (about 2.4m) or six shaku (about 1.8m) is longer than two steps but the basic unit of shaku was shorter in the times when bu was related to shaku.
Six shaku (about 1.8 m) and eight shaku (about 2.4 m) are actually longer than the length of two steps, however, because bu was related to shaku at a time when a shaku was shorter than it is now.

sen.j: 尺の長さが伸びたため、歩もそれに合わせて長くなった。
sen.e: The unit of shaku became longer, so the unit of bu became longer.
The unit of shaku became longer, so the unit of bu became longer.
The unit of shaku became longer, so the unit of bu became longer.

sen.j: 歩幅を長さの単位にすることは世界各地で行われており、英語圏ではペース（pace, 約76cm）、ドイツではシュリット（Schritt, 71～75cm）という単位が使われていた。
sen.e: The unit of length based on a step is used around the world and pace (about 76cm) was used in English-speaking countries, Shuritt (71-75cm), in German.
The unit of length based on a step was used around the world, and pace (about 76cm) was used in English-speaking countries while Shuritt (71-75cm) was used in Germany.
sen.cmt: カンマ追加、is→was、in German→in Germanyに修正、Shuritt (71-75cm)→while Shuritt (71-75cm) was usedとしました。
sen.e: The unit of length based on a step was used around the world, and pace (about 76cm) was used in English-speaking countries while Shuritt (71-75cm) was used in Germany.

sen.j: 古代ローマにはパッスス（passus）という単位があり、この1000倍のミレパッスム（mille passuum）がマイル（mile）の由来とされている。
sen.e: The unit of passus was used in ancient Rome and mile originated from mille passuum (thousandhold passus).
The unit of passus was used in ancient Rome and mile originated from mille passuum (thousandfold passus).

sen.j: 1歩（6尺）四方の面積のことも「歩」と言う。
sen.e: "Bu"also means a unit of area, one square bu (six shaku).

sen.j: 日本では同じ面積を指す坪という単位がある。
sen.e: Tsubo is also a unit of area in Japan and one tsubo is equal to one bu.
